alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 21 at 7:23AM MDT until June 23 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR MOST OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Although localized critical fire weather conditions are expected Wednesday and Thursday, widespread hot, dry, windy and unstable conditions will return Friday which will be preceeded by poor overnight humidity recovery. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), North Central Mountains (Zone 120), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zone 122), Northeast Highlands, (Zone 123), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), West Central Mountains (Zone 105), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
